ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: I would have preferred to use our two meeting times to have some instruction rather than sharing our progress. Perhaps we could have talked about best practices across industries, or examples of what good sustainability plans look like.
Too short. Everything was too fast (2 weeks to work on the project)

This was a quick mid-semester independent study that allowed students to participate in the Executive Education course on sustainability run by SOM. It was a great, brief way for us to get an overview of how companies think about sustainability and a good networking opportunity as well.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: It was good to have exposure to companies and work with "real-world" problems.
The opportunity to engage with companies actually working in this space and produce tangible results.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: It felt pretty crunched and rushed. It would have been nice to get the plans earlier and get instruction from Todd on what to look for/how to approach it. Also, more than 2 clients was too much.

I wish we had had more class sessions before the final presentations, or more opportunities to refine our content- this was a really quick time period during which we were still able to produce useful and relevant content for the participants, but more lead time could have helped refine and improve our materials further.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: This course was directly related to my career goals and overall program, as I'm interested in working as a corporate sustainability manager after graduation and will be doing this work regularly upon graduation.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I wanted to do some work for an external client.

I needed one more unit, wanted to engage with Todd Cort, and thought it would be a good way to build industry connections and gain some practical experience while in school without doing a full consulting clinic.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes, only wish we had had more time to refine our skills and engage with the companies during their time at Yale.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: It was great to work both with another student and a faculty member- they were very knowledgeable and we worked well as a team.
We had a partner for all our company projects and it was great as it helped us split up the work and make it more manageable, particularly given our short lead time on this course.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: It's a big time commitment and is pretty stressful, but it gives you great exposure to businesses and what they're dealing with.
Take it if you see there is a schedule with enough time to develop the project.
Great one unit course to gain actual exposure to company sustainability planning and do something different.
